1.text: Fold the t-shirt to align the shoulder seams at the neckline.

2.text: Flatten the fabric on a table to remove wrinkles and creases.
2.vid: /2/27/Cut the Neckline of a Shirt Step 2 Version 2.360p.mp4

3.text: Measure 1 in (2.5 cm) or more below the bottom of the collar.
3.vid: /f/f4/Cut the Neckline of a Shirt Step 3.360p.mp4

4.text: Trim the fabric in a curve following the shape of the collar for a scoop neck.
4.vid: /b/b1/Cut the Neckline of a Shirt Step 4 Version 2.360p.mp4

5.text: Cut in a straight line up to the shoulder seams to make a v-neck.
5.vid: /2/2b/Cut the Neckline of a Shirt Step 5 Version 2.360p.mp4

6.text: Pull on the neckline to loosen the fabric and roll the edges.

7.text: Fold the shirt by lining up the shoulder seams at the collar.
7.vid: /c/c6/Cut the Neckline of a Shirt Step 7 Version 2.360p.mp4

8.text: Use a piece of chalk to mark where you want the bottom point of your v-neck.

9.text: Mark a point between the middle of the collar and the shoulder seam.
9.vid: /e/ef/Cut the Neckline of a Shirt Step 9 Version 2.360p.mp4

10.text: Cut a straight line from the bottom point to the collar.
10.vid: /9/99/Cut the Neckline of a Shirt Step 10 Version 2.360p.mp4

11.text: Trim just below the collar to cut out the fabric triangle.
11.vid: /9/9e/Cut the Neckline of a Shirt Step 11 Version 2.360p.mp4

12.text: Tug on the edges of the triangle gently to roll the edges.

13.text: Lay the shirt flat on its back and smooth the fabric.

14.text: Make a 2–3 in (5.1–7.6 cm) cut around the collar line on both shoulders.
14.vid: /6/64/Cut the Neckline of a Shirt Step 14 Version 2.360p.mp4

15.text: Mark a spot that is 4 inches (10.2 cm) away from the collar, towards the shoulder.
15.vid: /3/37/Cut the Neckline of a Shirt Step 15 Version 2.360p.mp4

16.text: Cut a diagonal line from the marked spot to your first cut at the collar.
16.vid: /6/61/Cut the Neckline of a Shirt Step 16 Version 2.360p.mp4

17.text: Align the triangle with the cut on the other sleeve and use it as a guide.
17.vid: /a/a2/Cut the Neckline of a Shirt Step 17 Version 2.360p.mp4

18.text: Tug on the sides of the shoulder holes to stretch them slightly.
